alert.note: Alert for Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 14 at 4:27PM AKDT until March 15 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below zero. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold wind chills are occuring. Winds are expected to decrease on Wednesday afternoon and wind chills become less severe then, but very cold temperatures will continue into Thursday.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.
